comments.author: lisaiscooking
comments.content: I finally got over my fear of making gnocchi, but now I need to conquer the sauteeing and browning step. Mine just stuck to the pan. I assume I didn't use enough oil to coat them after they were boiled.? Your version sounds great with raddicchio and ricotta salata.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Interesting; yeah you shouldn't have sticking when you pan fry them. I agree, either you needed more oil in the post-boil toss, or in the pan when frying. Also, you want to use a skillet that isn't inclined to stick too much - either a non-stick pan or a cast iron skillet.

comments.author: Francie
comments.content: I too have always wanted to make gnocchi, but been afraid to try, but after seeing this delicious recipe....

comments.author: Mimi (Gingersnaps)
comments.content: I had no idea you could pan-fry gnocchi. Neat!

comments.author: Ambuja
comments.content: Where can you get Ricotta Salata? or do you make your own? I had some once at a restaurant once and loved it and have since been searching for it in the stores? Does whole foods carry it?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Ambuja - yes, Whole Foods has ricotta salata; you can also find it at a good Italian grocer.

comments.author: Alana
comments.content: Michael, after wanting to make these for ages, I finally got around to it on a cold winter afternoon. It was easier than i expected, though i could be a little speedier. mind you, your recipe yielded me almost 200 gnocchi! i've ordered the gnocchi board for next time. . .
